title: Personalized Federated Learning for Egocentric Video Gaze Estimation with Comprehensive Parameter Freezing
author: Yuhu Feng (Hokkaido University), Keisuke Maeda (Hokkaido University), Takahiro Ogawa (Hokkaido University), Miki Haseyama (Hokkaido University), ...
relevance_why: The proposed method of comprehensive parameter freezing in federated learning could inspire new approaches in managing personalized models in audio-related tasks where user-specific characteristics are essential.
background: The task involves estimating users' gaze in egocentric video footage through a federated learning framework while preserving the privacy of individual data.
contribution: This paper introduces a Personalized Federated Learning framework with Comprehensive Parameters Freezing to improve gaze estimation, achieving superior performance in recall, precision, and F1-score across datasets.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous federated learning methods may not effectively capture individual user characteristics due to selection methods that consider only single round changes.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves upon these methods by calculating average parameter changes over multiple iterations for better parameter selection, allowing for more effective personalization.

key_innovation: The unique aspect of the method is its capacity to freeze the most impactful parameters based on cumulative changes, enhancing individual client model performance.
real_world_impact: The framework has the potential to significantly enhance gaze estimation accuracy in various real-world applications such as augmented reality, preserving user privacy while offering tailored services.
limitations: The paper does not mention any explicit limitations.

new_terms.comprehensive parameter freezing: **Comprehensive parameter freezing** refers to a strategy that entails selecting and preserving the most impactful model parameters based on their change rates over multiple training iterations, ensuring effective personalization.
